Package shaharas

Class BaseUnaryOperators

java.lang.Object
shaharas.BaseOperators
shaharas.BaseUnaryOperators
All Implemented Interfaces:
Operators
Direct Known Subclasses:
AddOneLeft, AddOneRight, SubOneLeft, SubOneRight
abstract class BaseUnaryOperators extends BaseOperators
The BaseUnaryOperators class represents the general structure and behavior for unary operators in the system. It extends the BaseOperators class to inherit the common functionality for operators but adds functionality specific to unary operators, such as managing variables. Specific unary operators (such as increment, decrement, etc.) should extend this class and provide their unique implementations.

  • Constructor Details

    • BaseUnaryOperators

      public BaseUnaryOperators(int a, Pattern compile, String symbol, int priority, HashMap<String,VariableEXP> variables)
      Constructor to initialize a unary operator with its operand, regular expression pattern, symbol, priority, and the variables it will interact with.
      Parameters:
      a - The operand or value for the operator.
      compile - The compiled regular expression pattern to match the operator.
      symbol - The symbol representing the operator (e.g., "++", "--").
      priority - The priority of the operator, determining its precedence in expressions.
      variables - A map holding the variables used by the unary operator.

    • BaseUnaryOperators

      Copy constructor to create a new instance of BaseUnaryOperators by copying the state of the provided instance.
      Parameters:
      a - An existing BaseUnaryOperators object to be cloned.

    • clone

      public abstract Operators clone()
      Abstract method to clone the unary operator. Subclasses must implement this method to return a new instance of the unary operator with the same state as the original.
      Specified by:
      clone in interface Operators
      Specified by:
      clone in class BaseOperators
      Returns:
      A new instance of the unary operator that is a clone of the original.

    • calculate

      public abstract int calculate(String variable, int... args)
      Abstract method to perform the operation associated with the unary operator. Subclasses must implement this method to define how the unary operator will calculate its result based on variables.
      Specified by:
      calculate in interface Operators
      Specified by:
      calculate in class BaseOperators
      Parameters:
      variable - The name of the variable used in the operation (if applicable).
      args - The arguments to be used in the calculation (e.g., operands for the operation).
      Returns:
      The result of the operator's operation.
